page.title: 14I.O.W. RUGBY CLUB, WOOTTON
page.content: This successful club was formed at Ryde in 1924 by a group of 20 keen sportsmen who played matches against mainland opposition. The club moved to Wootton in 1969 and is now affiliated to the Hampshire Rugby Union. The clubhouse built by members was opened in 1971 and has a thriving bar, providing excellent facilities for discos, buffets and other social functions. Last season there were 87 playing members in the club, drawn from all walks of life plus a number of non-playing members and colts. Annual subscriptions are Â£17.50 for adults, half for colts and a regular match fee of Â£1.60 is collected after each game. The club now plays friendlies and matches in the Hampshire Senior Merit Table.
